intro: Lepyrodia drummondiana, commonly known as the Drummond's lepidote, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of flowers that attract pollinators like bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
